channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Stop line faded & ped studs on crossing. Requires borough to follow up to repaint., 7th November
item.description:
Stop line faded & ped studs on crossing. Requires borough to follow up to repaint.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piled up rubbish causing rotting stench, maybe dead animal, glass and possibly drugs waste, 7th November
item.description:
Fire escape door broken (picture shows entrance) so alley is used by druggies and people dumping rubbish. The rubbish is moist and stinks like sick, rotten orange skins and mouldy cloths. The smell is rising up into our flats above. Door needs fixing to stop people getting in and dumping rubbish. The rubbish is old and new. Pests rats an issue too.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Elm Grove, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked gullies and drains not draining properly, 7th November
item.description:
This has now been a problem for the whole year. We reported the issue to Bromey under two fix my street references 7909471 and earlier 7110467 but we believe the wrong drains were looked at initially and then blamed on Lewisham Council who now reassure us that these drains are the responsibility of Bromley Council. The drain is at the beginning of Beckenham Place Park outside the front door of The Gatehouse 24 Beckenham Place Park. When it rains the blocked gullies and full of sludge drains do not allow the water to drain properly. It is a danger as the significant flooding leads right to our front door and there is no other form of access to the building.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodlands, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road marking changed but not signage, 6th November
item.description:
The road marking in this area now indicates a right turn only in the left lane. This is causing major traffic disruption particularly as the signage suggests you can use the left lane to turn both right and left. It would be a traffic hell if the left lane cannot also be used to turn left so hopeful the road markings were changed in error.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Westmoreland Road, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 151 Tabot Centre, Granville Road NW6 5AR, 6th November
item.description:
Dog Mess along the wall. Children and Parents walk along and Residents. Health Hazard to all. Dog Walkers are a NUISANCE. MORE DOG SIGNS are Needed. Please CLEAN AWAY, it’s DISGRACEFUL and DISGUSTING to walk by. Elderly People also walk by. It’s NOT FAIR to anyone. Please clean ASAP.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Granville Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 outside number 3 (/, 6th November
item.description:
Crystal Palace Park Road SE26 outside number 3 (/ number 2 aka phone exchange) is a traffic island with square plastic bollards – bollards ref 1103 & 1104 – one of these tagged. Google Streetview: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Crystal+Palace+Park+Rd,+London/@51.4188965,-0.0613996,3a,75y,69.27h,80.45t/data=!3m7!1e1!3m5!1sPs2kNE3v0dhTYEajNbFRrw!2e0!6shttps:%2F%2Fstreetviewpixels-pa.googleapis.com%2Fv1%2Fthumbnail%3Fcb_client%3Dmaps_sv.tactile%26w%3D900%26h%3D600%26pitch%3D9.55256024313448%26panoid%3DPs2kNE3v0dhTYEajNbFRrw%26yaw%3D69.26877161710182!7i16384!8i8192!4m6!3m5!1s0x4876015c84eacdb7:0xbb6b35473b07adf8!8m2!3d51.4236855!4d-0.0642803!16s%2Fg%2F1wn3343w?authuser=0&entry=ttu&g_ep=EgoyMDI1MTEwNC4xIKXMDSoASAFQAw%3D%3D
